title: Particle motion - total distance from velocity

content.question: A particle moves along the x-axis so that its velocity at time <math> <mrow> <mi>t</mi> <mo>≥</mo> <mn>0</mn> </mrow> </math> is given by <math> <mrow> <mi>v</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <msup> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mo>−</mo> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> <mrow> <msup> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mo>+</mo> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> </math>. What is the total distance traveled by the particle from <math> <mrow> <mi>t</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>0</mn> </mrow> </math> to <math> <mrow> <mi>t</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </math> ?

topic.text: 8.2: Connecting Position, Velocity, and Acceleration Functions Using Integrals

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
